---
title: "openapi_v2.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This file contains an OpenAPI (formerly known as Swagger) specification in YAML format for a simple pet store API. It defines the API's endpoints, request/response structures, and data models for a basic pet management system.

## API/Interface Reference
The API defines the following endpoints:

| Endpoint | Method | Description |
|:---------|:-------|:------------|
| /pets | GET | List all pets with optional pagination |
| /pets | POST | Create a new pet |
| /pets/{petId} | GET | Retrieve information about a specific pet |

### `/pets` (GET)
#### Description
Retrieves a list of pets with optional pagination.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| limit | integer (query parameter) | Maximum number of items to return (max 100) |

#### Outputs
| Status Code | Description |
|:------------|:------------|
| 200 | A paged array of pets |
| default | Unexpected error |

### `/pets` (POST)
#### Description
Creates a new pet.

#### Outputs
| Status Code | Description |
|:------------|:------------|
| 201 | Null response (successful creation) |
| default | Unexpected error |

### `/pets/{petId}` (GET)
#### Description
Retrieves information about a specific pet.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| petId | string (path parameter) | The ID of the pet to retrieve |

#### Outputs
| Status Code | Description |
|:------------|:------------|
| 200 | Expected response to a valid request |
| default | Unexpected error |

## Dependencies
The API specification uses the OpenAPI 2.0 (Swagger) format.

## Configuration
| Option | Value | Description |
|:-------|:------|:------------|
| swagger | "2.0" | Specifies the OpenAPI version |
| host | petstore.swagger.io | The base URL for the API |
| basePath | /v1 | The base path for all endpoints |
| schemes | ["http"] | The supported transfer protocols |
| consumes | ["application/json"] | Supported request content types |
| produces | ["application/json"] | Supported response content types |

## Definitions
The API specification defines the following data models:

### Pet
Represents a pet in the system.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|:---------|:-----|:---------|:------------|
| id | integer (int64) | Yes | The pet's unique identifier |
| name | string | Yes | The pet's name |
| tag | string | No | An optional tag for the pet |

### Pets
An array of Pet objects.

### Error
Represents an error response.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|:---------|:-----|:---------|:------------|
| code | integer (int32) | Yes | The error code |
| message | string | Yes | The error message |

This OpenAPI specification provides a clear and structured definition of the pet store API, including its endpoints, request/response formats, and data models. It serves as a contract between the API provider and consumers, facilitating easier integration and understanding of the API's capabilities.
